body:
You'll want to report this at [dulwich](https://github.com/jelmer/dulwich)

Meanwhile - per the docs - there's an escape hatch https://python-poetry.org/docs/configuration/#experimentalsystem-git-client
This is now fixed in dulwich master FWIW.

issue.title: Apply insteadOf to rsync-style location strings as well
issue.body:
Apply insteadOf to rsync-style location strings as well
  
Previously, these were just applied to plain URLs.
  
Fixes python-poetry/poetry#6329

issue.title: Unable to install https dependencies
issue.body:
After upgrading to `poetry` to `1.2.0`, which I understand uses `dulwich` internally, I started receiving this error on my local machine when trying to install git dependencies: 

```
ssh: Could not resolve hostname https: nodename nor servname provided, or not known
```

Disabling the `dulwich` using the [escape hatch](https://python-poetry.org/docs/configuration/#experimentalsystem-git-client) seemed to resolve this issue. This issue also seems to have plagued our CI/CD pipeline, so we've downgraded all `poetry` versions for the time being.

issue.title: Bump to Dulwich 0.20.46

repository.name: poetry
repository.description: Python packaging and dependency management made easy

issue.body:
Bump to Dulwich 0.20.46.

This version applies applyInsteadOf to rsync-style URLs. Fixes #6329

issue.title: [1.2] build(deps): bump `dulwich` to `0.20.46`

repository.name: poetry

issue.body: Backport https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/pull/6506, since it fixes a regression introduced in 1.2.0 (see [issue](https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/issues/6329)).
